channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crypto is getting punched in the face again—but this is no 2022
item.description: Bitcoin nearly fell below $80,000 and it could get worse. But the fundamentals are different this time.

item.title: Generative AI And LLMs Are Valuable Psychometric Instruments For Gauging Human Mental Health At Scale
item.description: The latest AI and LLMs can be used to at-scale measure societal mental health. We ought to devise new psychometrics accordingly. An AI Insider scoop.

item.description: Lithuania wants AI companies to ship products that meet EU’s toughest rules without burning a hole in their runway or slowing their ability to compete...

item.title: I chatted to Ray Dalio’s AI doppelgänger: It claims there’s a 75% chance the AI bubble bursts in 2026, isn’t so worried about national debt—and wouldn’t say which stocks to avoid
item.description: "One thing I’ve learned over the years," the freshly-launched bot muses, "Is that rapid, debt-financed build-outs often precede sharp adjustments.

item.title: Porn Ban—Google’s ‘Invisible’ Tracking Is Already On Your Phone
item.description: Porn bans do not work — VPN use is surging. But Google’s hidden phone tracking cannot be disabled and it’s already in use.

item.title: Middle-income Americans pessimistic about their financial future amid persistent inflation, analysis shows
item.description: Study reveals only 21% of middle-income Americans expect better finances next year, down from 33% in 2020, as inflation creates widespread pessimism.

item.title: DEI consultant resigns from Cracker Barrel board after heated proxy fight
item.description: Cracker Barrel shareholders backed nine of 10 board nominees, including CEO Julie Felss Masino.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup

item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
